title: Symphony No. 5 in C minor, Op. 67 - 1st Movement
fun_fact: The famous 'da-da-da-DUM' motif is one of the most recognizable in all of classical music.

title: Eine kleine Nachtmusik - 1st Movement
fun_fact: The title translates to 'A Little Night Music' - it's one of Mozart's most popular compositions.

title: Toccata and Fugue in D minor, BWV 565
fun_fact: Often used in horror films, this piece is one of the most famous organ works ever written.

title: Canon in D
fun_fact: Despite being Pachelbel's most famous work, it was largely forgotten until the 20th century.

title: Ride of the Valkyries
fun_fact: Made famous by its use in the film Apocalypse Now during a helicopter assault scene.

title: The Blue Danube Waltz
fun_fact: Often called Austria's unofficial national anthem, it's performed annually at the Vienna New Year's Concert.

title: Hungarian Rhapsody No. 2
fun_fact: This piece has been featured in numerous cartoons, including Tom and Jerry and Bugs Bunny.

title: Piano Sonata No. 14 'Moonlight' - 1st Movement
fun_fact: Beethoven himself was not fond of this piece, despite its immense popularity.

title: In the Hall of the Mountain King
fun_fact: Grieg himself said he 'literally can't stand' this piece because it 'reeks of cow dung and Norwegian nationalism.'

title: Morning Mood (Peer Gynt)
fun_fact: Despite being about a Norwegian troll, this piece was meant to depict a sunrise in Morocco.

title: Minute Waltz (Waltz in D-flat major, Op. 64 No. 1)
fun_fact: The name means 'small' waltz (from Latin 'minutus'), not that it should be played in one minute.

title: Clair de Lune
fun_fact: The title means 'moonlight' in French and was inspired by a poem by Paul Verlaine.

title: Boléro
fun_fact: Ravel described it as 'a piece for orchestra without music' - it's one continuous crescendo.

title: Habanera (Carmen)
fun_fact: Bizet died just three months after the opera's premiere, never knowing it would become a masterpiece.

title: Ave Maria
fun_fact: The original text was from a Walter Scott poem, not the Latin prayer, which was added later.

title: Symphony No. 8 'Unfinished' - 1st Movement
fun_fact: Schubert only completed two movements, and no one knows why he stopped.

title: Piano Concerto No. 2 - 1st Movement
fun_fact: Composed after recovering from depression with the help of hypnotherapy.

title: Symphony No. 5 - 2nd Movement (Adagio)
fun_fact: This Adagietto was used in the film Death in Venice and is often played at funerals.

title: La donna è mobile (Rigoletto)
fun_fact: Verdi kept this aria secret until the premiere to prevent it from being leaked.

title: Nessun dorma (Turandot)
fun_fact: Made world-famous by Luciano Pavarotti's performances, especially at the 1990 World Cup.

title: Brandenburg Concerto No. 3 - 1st Movement
fun_fact: Bach sent these concertos as a job application to the Margrave of Brandenburg, who never responded.

title: Hallelujah Chorus (Messiah)
fun_fact: Tradition says King George II stood during this chorus, starting the custom of audiences standing.

title: Hungarian Dance No. 5
fun_fact: This is actually based on a Hungarian folk song, which led to accusations of plagiarism.

title: Symphony No. 9 'From the New World' - 2nd Movement (Largo)
fun_fact: Composed in New York, it was inspired by Native American music and African American spirituals.

title: The Moldau (Vltava)
fun_fact: This symphonic poem depicts the journey of the Vltava river through the Czech countryside to Prague.

title: The Bartered Bride - Overture
fun_fact: This comic opera is considered the first great Czech national opera and remains Smetana's most popular work.

title: Romeo and Juliet - Dance of the Knights
fun_fact: Also known as 'Montagues and Capulets,' it became the theme for the UK show The Apprentice.
